hanzi-su-wiki:
雅

Значения

Элегантный, утонченный

Мнемоника

Клюв птицы 隹 красив и похож на зуб 牙.
purpleculture_pinyin:
yǎ
elegant
элегантный
rtega_mnemonic:
鴉鴉RS
鸦鸦		雅鵶𩿎𩿗𪀨𪀹 crow, raven
  • bird 鳥 that can bite like it has teeth 牙

雅雅RSelegant, graceful, refined
  • elegant like a bird 隹 or like the teeth of an elephant 牙
purpleculture_info:
Antonyms: 俗
Pictophonetic: 牙 indicates the sound; 隹 (bird) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
高雅 [ gāo yǎ ]: dainty; elegance; elegant
雅加达 [ yǎ jiā dá ]: Jakarta, capital of Indonesia
优雅 [ yōu yǎ ]: grace; graceful
典雅 [ diǎn yǎ ]: refined; elegant
文雅 [ wén yǎ ]: elegant; refined
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 牙 [ yá ] tooth, molar; fang, tusk; serrated
    • 隹 [ zhuī ] short-tailed bird; sparrow
heisig_chinese_memo: Goodness gracious! Such a polished turkey with a tusk.
koohiiStory1: Goodness gracious! Such an elegant turkey with a tusk. This mnemonic is meant to join RtK´s keyword with a better proposition. Heisig could have used "elegant" here, which is not confounded so easily with graceful (#721), and accurately represents the character´s meaning (it is also the chosen keyword in Kodansha´s Kanji Learner´s Dictionary).
koohiiStory2: To not confuse it with grace (#606) or graceful (#721), think of the phrase "Goodness gracious." Like: "Goodness gracious! A turkey with tusks!".
jp_example_words: 雅致(がち): artistry, good taste, elegance, grace
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A fang on a turkey is elegant. Most turkeys do not have fangs, so this turkey with a fang is quite elegant and dignified. This turkey is special.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Look at this turkey with a fang. It’s elegant, but also frightening. See the fanged turkey staring at you menacingly.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This elegant fang makes the turkey look more like a gargoyle (が) than a turkey. In fact, you haven't seen it move at all. Maybe it is just an elegant gargoyle!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture this elegant gargoyle sitting in front of you. Reach out your hand and feels its hard, elegant stone gargoyle body.
Ru_Notes:
雅びたみやびた
  • элегантный, утончённый, изысканный
    • 典雅なてんがな
  • утончённый, изысканный, изящный
    • 博雅のはくがの
  • знающий, хорошо осведомлённый
    • 雅懐がかい
  • чувство прекрасного
    • 雅量がりょう
  • терпимость, снисходительность, великодушие
Ru_Words: Сравни: 冴(さえる、ゴ ясный, отчётливый), 穿 (うがつ、セン рыть, сверлить, надевать на ноги), 芽(め、ガ побег, росток)
Ru_trainchinese:
yǎ: (графема) изящный, изысканный, элегантный; (книжн.) надлежащий, правильный; одна из трех глав "Книги песен"
yǎ: (графема) (книжн.) знакомство; (книжн.) обычно; (книжн.) очень
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the little bird's (隹) tusk (牙) is elegant
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Goodness gracious! Such a polished turkey with a tusk.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "隹", " tooth " sound. The original meaning is crow. "Shuowen": "Ya, Chu Wu Ye. A 鸒. A humble residence. Qin said that Ya is elegant. Cong Yu, Ya Sheng." "Ji Yun. "Ma Yun": "Ya, or as a crow or 鵶." Later, " Ya " was borrowed to express the " Ya " which is elegant and righteous. The original meaning was changed to " Crow ". See " crow ".

" Ya " means positive, which means conforming to norms and standards. "Jade articles. "Bibu": "Elegant, Zhengye." Such as "The Analects. "Shuer": "The elegant words of Zi, "Poetry", "Book", and rituals are all elegant words." "Yayan" is the standard language. Another example is "Xunzi. "The King System": "The three generations are said to be turmoil, and the second king of the law is said to be indecent." Yang Jie's note: "Elegance, righteousness. Regardless of what happened at the time, it is said that it is not righteous." The ancient exegetical books were also named " Ya ", such as "Er Ya", "Guang Ya" and "Tong Ya". "Release name. Shi Dianyi: "Erya, Er, Niye; Ni, Jinye; Ya, Yiye; Righteousness, Zhengye. The five dialects are different, and Jinzheng is the main one."

" Ya " implies nobleness and elegance. Such as "The Songs of the Chu. Chapter Nine. Big Move": "Rong is beautiful, and Zhu Yan is only." "Historical Records. Biographies of Pingjin Houzhu's Father: "Elegant means Gongsunhong, Dong Zhongshu, and Erkuan, and dedication means Shi Jian and Shi Qing." "Ma Yuan Biography": "Bo Yi square collar, able to take steps, elegant rhetoric, help judges and learn books, see it at one's own expense."

" Ya " is one of the "six meanings" of "Poem". "Preface to Mao Poetry": "Therefore, "The Poetry" has six meanings, one is wind, the second is fu, the third is bi, the fourth is xing, the fifth is elegance, and the sixth is ode." Xiaoya. "Preface to Mao Poetry": "Elegant person, righteousness, saying that the cause of the king's government is to waste and prosper. The government is small and big, so there is "Xiaoya" Yan, and "Daya" Yan." Zheng Qiao refers to " Ya " which means " The Voice of the Court".

" Ya " is the name of an ancient musical instrument. "Zhou Li. Chunguan. "Master Sheng": "Master Sheng teaches 竽, sheng, xun, 籥, flute, 篪, 篴, tube, pounding 牍, response, and elegance, in order to teach the happiness." Zheng Xuan quoted Zheng Sinong as saying: "Ya, It looks like a lacquer with a long mouth, and is large in size. It is five feet six inches long. It has two groups of sparse paintings based on the sheep and Wei Qian." "Book of Rites. "Yue Ji" "Xun Ji Yi Ya", Zheng Xuan's note: "Elegance is also the name of the instrument. It looks like a lacquer 筩, with a vertebra in the middle."

" Ya " also refers to the Wanwu of the Zhou Dynasty. "poetry. Xiaoya. "Drum Bell": "South of Yiya, Yixian is not arrogant." Zheng Xuanjian: "Ya, Wanwuye. Wanye, Nanye, and Xieye, three dances are not arrogant, and the journey of words advances and retreats. Zhou Le Shangwu, So Wanwu is elegant."

" Ya " is used as an adverb, which means always and ordinary. "Jade articles. "Bibu": "Elegant, Su also." Such as "Historical Records. "Benji of Gaozu": "Yong Chi Ya does not want to belong to Pei Gong, and Wei Zhaozhi, that is, Wei Shoufeng." Pei Qi "Ji Jie" quotes Qian and said: "Ya, so also." "Han Shu. "Gongsun Hongbu Shier Kuan Biography": "Qi Xiangya goes to farming, reorganizes with her husband, and divides the Kundi, not for profit and confusion." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. "Legal Questions and Answers" Jane 12: "A and B are not wise (knowledge)." That is, A and B do not know each other.

" Ya " as an adverb also means very, very. "anthology. Yang Ziyou "Report to Sun Huizong": "Women, Zhao and Daughters, Yashan, drums and pianos, and several slaves and maidservants, have hot ears after drinking, and look up to the sky and caress the fou while whirring." "Hou Han Shu. "The First Queen's Chronicles": "Suzong first hears about it and then has talents and colors, and counts to inform Jifu. Seeing, elegant and beautiful." "Book of Jin. "The Biography of Wang Xi": "Yangzhou Governor Yin Hao is so elegant and heavy."

" Ya " is commonly used as " summer ." Zhu Junsheng "Shu Wen Tong Xun Ding Sheng": "Elegant, 叚borrow and summer." Such as "Xunzi. Honor and Disgrace: "For example, the more people are safe, the Chu people are safe, and the gentlemen are safe." Wang Yinzhi said: "Ya reads as summer. Xia is also called China." "Guodian Jian. "Bao Yi" "Da Xia (Ya)" and "Xiao Xia (Ya)" are pronounced "Daya" and "Xiaoya".
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "隹" and " tooth ". The original meaning is crow, which was later borrowed to express elegance and integrity, and extended to express noble and elegant.
humanum_full_description:
從「隹」，「牙」聲。本義是烏鴉。《說文》：「雅，楚烏也。一名鸒。一名卑居。秦謂之雅。从隹，牙聲。」《集韻．麻韻》：「雅，或作鴉、鵶。」後來「雅」被借去表示雅正的「雅」，本義則改由「鴉」表示。參見「鴉」。

　　「雅」表示正，即合於規範、標準的意思。《玉篇．隹部》：「雅，正也。」如《論語．述而》：「子所雅言，《詩》、《書》、執禮，皆雅言也。」「雅言」即標準語。又如《荀子．王制》：「道過三代謂之蕩，法貳後王謂之不雅。」楊倞注：「雅，正也。其治法不論當時之事，而廣說遠古，則為不正也。」古代的訓詁之書亦多以「雅」為名，如《爾雅》、《廣雅》和《通雅》。《釋名．釋典藝》：「爾雅，爾，昵也；昵，近也；雅，義也；義，正也。五方之言不同，皆以近正為主也。」

　　「雅」引申表示高尚、優雅。如《楚辭．九章．大招》：「容則秀雅，穉朱顏只。」《史記．平津侯主父列傳》：「儒雅則公孫弘、董仲舒、兒寬，篤行則石建、石慶。」《後漢書．馬援列傳》：「勃衣方領，能矩步，辭言嫻雅，援裁知書，見之自失。」

　　「雅」是《詩》「六義」之一。《毛詩序》：「故《詩》有六義焉，一曰風，二曰賦，三曰比，四曰興，五曰雅，六曰頌。」《詩》有《大雅》和《小雅》。《毛詩序》：「雅者、正也，言王政之所由廢興也。政有小大，故有《小雅》焉，有《大雅》焉。」鄭樵指「雅」即「朝庭之音」。

　　「雅」是古代樂器之名。《周禮．春官．笙師》：「笙師掌教龡竽、笙、塤、籥、簫、篪、篴、管，舂牘、應、雅，以教祴樂。」鄭玄注引鄭司農曰：「雅，狀如漆筩而弇口，大二圍，長五尺六寸，以羊韋鞔之，有兩組疏畫。」《禮記．樂記》「訊疾以雅」，鄭玄注：「雅亦樂器名也。狀如漆筩，中有椎。」

　　「雅」亦指周代的萬舞。《詩．小雅．鼓鍾》：「以雅以南，以籥不僭。」鄭玄箋：「雅，萬舞也。萬也、南也、籥也，三舞不僭，言進退之旅也。周樂尚武，故謂萬舞為雅。」

　　「雅」作副詞，表示向來、平素。《玉篇．隹部》：「雅，素也。」如《史記．高祖本紀》：「雍齒雅不欲屬沛公，及魏招之，即反為魏守豐。」裴駰《集解》引服虔曰：「雅，故也。」《漢書．公孫弘卜式兒寬傳》：「齊相雅行躬耕，隨牧蓄番，輒分昆弟，更造，不為利惑。」《睡虎地秦簡．法律答問》簡12：「甲乙雅不相智（知）。」即甲乙素不相識。

　　「雅」作副詞亦表示很、非常。《文選．楊子幼〈報孫會宗書〉》：「婦趙女也，雅善鼓琴，奴婢歌者數人，酒後耳熱，仰天撫缶而呼嗚嗚。」《後漢書．皇后紀上》：「肅宗先聞后有才色，數以訊諸姬傅。及見，雅以為美。」《晉書．王羲之傳》：「揚州刺史殷浩素雅重之。」

　　「雅」通作「夏」。朱駿聲《說文通訓定聲》：「雅，叚借又為夏。」如《荀子．榮辱》：「譬之越人安越，楚人安楚，君子安雅。」王引之曰：「雅讀為夏。夏，謂中國也。」《郭店簡．緇衣》「大夏（雅）」和「小夏（雅）」讀為「大雅」和「小雅」。
humanum_short_description: 從「隹」，「牙」聲。本義是烏鴉，後被借去表示雅正，引申表示高尚、典雅。

HSK 6: 啞,雅,哑
鴉鴉RS
鸦鸦 		雅 鵶 𩿎 𩿗 𪀨 𪀹 crow, raven
  • bird 鳥 that can bite like it has teeth 牙

雅雅RS elegant, graceful, refined
  • elegant like a bird 隹 or like the teeth of an elephant 牙
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 俗
Pictophonetic: 牙 indicates the sound; 隹 (bird) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 牙 [ yá ] tooth, molar; fang, tusk; serrated
    • 隹 [ zhuī ] short-tailed bird; sparrow
①正规的，标准的：雅言。雅正(ａ．规范的；b．正直；c．客气话，用于赠给他人的书画题款上，请对方指正)。
②美好的，高尚的，不粗俗的：文雅。高雅。典雅。雅观。雅教(jiào)。雅兴(xìng)。雅座。雅俗。
③平素，素来：雅爱。雅善鼓琴。
④极，甚：雅以为美。雅不欲为。
⑤交往：无一日之雅。
⑥酒器名：雅量(liàng)(ａ．大的酒量；b．宽宏的气度)。
⑦中国周代朝庭上的乐歌：风雅颂。雅声(泛指诗歌)。
⑧古同“鸦”，乌鸦。

從「 隹 」，「 牙 」聲。本義是烏鴉。《說文》：「雅，楚烏也。一名鸒。一名卑居。秦謂之雅。从隹，牙聲。」《集韻．麻韻》：「雅，或作鴉、鵶。」後來「 雅 」被借去表示雅正的「 雅 」，本義則改由「 鴉 」表示。參見「 鴉 」。 「 雅 」表示正，即合於規範、標準的意思。《玉篇．隹部》：「雅，正也。」如《論語．述而》：「子所雅言，《詩》、《書》、執禮，皆雅言也。」「雅言」即標準語。又如《荀子．王制》：「道過三代謂之蕩，法貳後王謂之不雅。」楊倞注：「雅，正也。其治法不論當時之事，而廣說遠古，則為不正也。」古代的訓詁之書亦多以「 雅 」為名，如《爾雅》、《廣雅》和《通雅》。《釋名．釋典藝》：「爾雅，爾，昵也；昵，近也；雅，義也；義，正也。五方之言不同，皆以近正為主也。」 「 雅 」引申表示高尚、優雅。如《楚辭．九章．大招》：「容則秀雅，穉朱顏只。」《史記．平津侯主父列傳》：「儒雅則公孫弘、董仲舒、兒寬，篤行則石建、石慶。」《後漢書．馬援列傳》：「勃衣方領，能矩步，辭言嫻雅，援裁知書，見之自失。」 「 雅 」是《詩》「六義」之一。《毛詩序》：「故《詩》有六義焉，一曰風，二曰賦，三曰比，四曰興，五曰雅，六曰頌。」《詩》有《大雅》和《小雅》。《毛詩序》：「雅者、正也，言王政之所由廢興也。政有小大，故有《小雅》焉，有《大雅》焉。」鄭樵指「 雅 」即「朝庭之音」。 「 雅 」是古代樂器之名。《周禮．春官．笙師》：「笙師掌教龡竽、笙、塤、籥、簫、篪、篴、管，舂牘、應、雅，以教祴樂。」鄭玄注引鄭司農曰：「雅，狀如漆筩而弇口，大二圍，長五尺六寸，以羊韋鞔之，有兩組疏畫。」《禮記．樂記》「訊疾以雅」，鄭玄注：「雅亦樂器名也。狀如漆筩，中有椎。」 「 雅 」亦指周代的萬舞。《詩．小雅．鼓鍾》：「以雅以南，以籥不僭。」鄭玄箋：「雅，萬舞也。萬也、南也、籥也，三舞不僭，言進退之旅也。周樂尚武，故謂萬舞為雅。」 「 雅 」作副詞，表示向來、平素。《玉篇．隹部》：「雅，素也。」如《史記．高祖本紀》：「雍齒雅不欲屬沛公，及魏招之，即反為魏守豐。」裴駰《集解》引服虔曰：「雅，故也。」《漢書．公孫弘卜式兒寬傳》：「齊相雅行躬耕，隨牧蓄番，輒分昆弟，更造，不為利惑。」《睡虎地秦簡．法律答問》簡12：「甲乙雅不相智（知）。」即甲乙素不相識。 「 雅 」作副詞亦表示很、非常。《文選．楊子幼〈報孫會宗書〉》：「婦趙女也，雅善鼓琴，奴婢歌者數人，酒後耳熱，仰天撫缶而呼嗚嗚。」《後漢書．皇后紀上》：「肅宗先聞后有才色，數以訊諸姬傅。及見，雅以為美。」《晉書．王羲之傳》：「揚州刺史殷浩素雅重之。」 「 雅 」通作「 夏 」。朱駿聲《說文通訓定聲》：「雅，叚借又為夏。」如《荀子．榮辱》：「譬之越人安越，楚人安楚，君子安雅。」王引之曰：「雅讀為夏。夏，謂中國也。」《郭店簡．緇衣》「大夏（雅）」和「小夏（雅）」讀為「大雅」和「小雅」。

雅字的基本解释

雅
yǎ
正规的，标准的：雅言。雅正（ａ．规范的；ｂ．正直；ｃ．客气话，用于赠给他人的书画题款上，请对方指正）。
美好的，高尚的，不粗俗的：文雅。高雅。典雅。雅观。雅教（ji刼 ）。雅兴（x宯g ）。雅座。雅俗。
平素，素来：雅爱。雅善鼓琴。
极，甚：雅以为美。雅不欲为。
交往：无一日之雅。
酒器名：雅量（li刵g ）（ａ．大的酒量；ｂ．宽宏的气度）。
中国周代朝庭上的乐歌：风雅颂。雅声（泛指诗歌）。
古同“鸦”，乌鸦。

[①]［yǎ］
［《廣韻》五下切，上馬，疑。］
“疋2”的今字。
(1)正；合乎规范、标准的。
(2)高雅不俗；优美。
(3)用作敬词，多用于称与对方有关的事。参见“雅貺”、“雅屬”。
(4)交情。
(5)《诗经》六义之一。
(6)借指诗文。
(7)指文人雅士。
(8)指雅言。标准语。古代训诂著作多称雅，如《尔雅》、《小尔雅》、《广雅》、《埤雅》等。
(9)指周代的万舞。
(10)古乐器名。
(11)指雅乐。
(12)古酒器名。
(13)指（酒量）大。
(14)隋时乐曲部类之一。
(15)戏曲名词。指昆曲。参见“雅部”。
(16)副词。素常；向来。
(17)副词。甚，颇。
(18)发语词。
(19)通“夏”。指中国，即今中原地区。
(20)姓。元有雅琥，著有《正卿集》。
[②]［yā］
［《廣韻》五下切，上馬，疑。］
(1)“鴉”的古字。
(2)用同“丫”。参见“雅2鬟”。
[③]［yá］
［《集韻》牛加切，平麻，疑。］

雅字的起名意思

：一般指文雅、美好、标准，引申为正直、高尚。

elegant
Basic explanation of words
elegant
yǎ
Formal, standard: Yayan. Yazheng (a. Normative; b. Integrity; C. Kind words, used for painting and calligraphy questions given to others, please correct them).
Beautiful, noble, not vulgar: elegant. elegant. Elegant. Elegant. Yajiao (ji 刼). Yaxing (x 宯g). Elegant seat. Elegant and vulgar.
Normally, always: Ya Ai. Yashan drum and piano.
Extremely, extremely: elegant as beautiful. Ya don't want to be.
Communication: There is no such thing as a day.
The name of the wine vessel: Yaliang (li 刵g) (a. Large drinking capacity; b. Generous tolerance).
Songs in the courts of the Zhou Dynasty in China: Songs of Feng Ya. Yasheng (referring to poetry in general).
The ancient same "crow", the crow.

elegant
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yǎ］
["Guangyun" cut five times, mount on horse, doubt. ]
The present word for "疋2".
(1) Positive; conforming to norms and standards.
(2) Elegance is not vulgar; beautiful.
(3) Used as a respectful word, mostly used to refer to things related to the other party. See "Ya Ben", "Ya Genus".
(4) Friendship.
(5) One of the six meanings of "The Book of Songs".
(6) By referring to poetry.
(7) Refers to literati elegant scholars.
(8) Refers to Yayan. Standard language. Ancient exegetical works called "Elegance", such as "Er Ya", "Little Elegance", "Guang Ya", "Bi Ya" and so on.
(9) Refers to Wanwu of Zhou Dynasty.
(10) The name of the ancient musical instrument.
(11) Refers to Yale.
(12) The name of the ancient wine vessel.
(13) Refers to (amount of alcohol) large.
(14) One of Sui Dynasty music category.
(15) Opera terms. Refers to Kunqu Opera. See "Yabu".
(16) Adverbs. Suchang; always.
(17) Adverbs. Very, quite.
(18) Spoken words.
(19) Through "Xia". Refers to China, now the Central Plains region.
(20) Last name. There is Yahu in Yuan Dynasty, and the author of "The Collection of Zheng Qing".
[②]［yā］
["Guangyun" cut five times, mount on horse, doubt. ]
(1) The ancient word for "crow".
(2) Same as "A". See "Ya 2 Hu".
[③] [yá]
["Jiyun" Niu Jiaqie, Ping Ma, Doubt. ]

IV собств.
Я (фамилия)
yā вм. 鸦
Radicals: 牙, 隹  (fang, turkey)
Meaning Mnemonic
A fang on a turkey is elegant. Most turkeys do not have fangs, so this turkey with a fang is quite elegant and dignified. This turkey is special.
Look at this turkey with a fang. It’s elegant, but also frightening. See the fanged turkey staring at you menacingly.
Reading Mnemonic
This elegant fang makes the turkey look more like a gargoyle (が) than a turkey. In fact, you haven't seen it move at all. Maybe it is just an elegant gargoyle!
Picture this elegant gargoyle sitting in front of you. Reach out your hand and feels its hard, elegant stone gargoyle body.

牙 (клык), 隹 (старая птица)
雅びたみやびた
  • элегантный, утончённый, изысканный
    • 典雅なてんがな
  • утончённый, изысканный, изящный
    • 博雅のはくがの
  • знающий, хорошо осведомлённый
    • 雅懐がかい
  • чувство прекрасного
    • 雅量がりょう
  • терпимость, снисходительность, великодушие
    • Сравни: 冴(さえる、ゴ ясный, отчётливый), 穿 (うがつ、セン рыть, сверлить, надевать на ноги), 芽(め、ガ побег, росток)
